title: Mass UK Train Stabbing Leaves Nine Fighting for Life; Two Arrested | 10 News
description: Counter-terrorism police in the UK are investigating a stabbing rampage on a train bound for London.   Two attackers chased passengers through carriages, leaving nine people fighting for life. title: Path Forward Uncertain for Liberals as Nationals Withdraw Net Zero Support | 10 News
description: The Nationals have officially dumped their support for getting Australia to net zero emissions by 2050.  They unanimously came to the decision in a special party room meeting today which former leader Barnaby Joyce didn't attend.  The Nats decision to abandon the policy isn't surprising, but it creates a problem for the Liberals. title: President Donald Trump Threatens Military Action In West Africa Over Escalating Violence | 10 News
description: In his latest proclamation on social media the US President has threatened to take military action inside West Africa.   Donald Trump has escalated his language towards the Nigerian Government, accusing it of failing to protect Christians from increasing violence.   If it doesn't move fast, he says - America could go in guns-blazing. title: Man and Woman in Custody over Louvre Heist as Police Probe Wider Network | 10 News
description: Two more people accused of involvement in the Louvre heist are in custody, as authorities continue to trace the movements of an organised network.  A man and woman have been charged, while three others with them when police made the arrest, have been let go. title: Australian Father’s Mission To Help Solve UK Knife Crime Crisis | 10 News+
description: As the UK reels from a mass stabbing on a public train, one Australian father is on a mission to help solve the nation's knife crime crisis.   Brett Beasley is right now on his way to London to sell Jack's Law, which was created after his son was stabbed to death in 2019.   The powers allow police to wand citizens for knives and Brett believes it will help save lives in the UK. title: Exploring Options As Victoria Crime Crises Rages On | 10 News+
description: Crime has soared to record levels in Victoria with violent home invasions, carjackings and stabbings among the growingly frequent offences.   The Premier insists her tougher bail laws, and a machete ban will reign in the lawlessness, however, others disagree. Sam Butler has been investigating. title: UK Train Knife Attack Not Being Treated As Terrorist Incident | 10 News
description: UK Police have confirmed that a knife attack on a London-bound train that left 11 in hospital, is not being treated as a terrorist incident.  Police immediately arrested two men following the attack at Huntingdon Train Station, both of whom were British nationals, before releasing one without charge.  A 32-year-old man remains under arrest and is being questioned on suspicion of attempted murder.  Six victims remain in hospital, with one in a life-threatening condition. title: Netanyahu States “Pockets” Of Hamas Remain In Israeli-Controlled Areas Of The Gaza Strip | 10 News
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that "there are still pockets of Hamas" in some of the Israeli-controlled areas of the Gaza Strip. "There are actually two in Rafah and Khan Younis, and they will be eliminated," he said. Netanyahu stated that disarming Hamas remains one of Israel’s main goals, and "if this is not done in one way, then it will be done in another way, and everyone knows what the other way is and who will also carry it out." title: Motorcyclist Caught By Police Performing Wheelie | 10 News
description: A Queensland motorcyclist has been nabbed by police while performing a wheelie when allegedly detected riding at 45 km/h over the speed limit.  Police allegedly detected the 22-year-old Carters Ridge man riding at 155 km/h in a 110 km/h zone and hit with a $3,008 fine, nine demerit points and a six-month licence suspension. title: At Least 15 Dead, 30 Missing After Landslide Hits Kenya | 10 News
description: At least 15 people are dead after a landslide hit Kenya’s Marakwet East region early on Saturday, November 1. Interior Cabinet Secretary Kipchumba Murkomen said 25 people had been rescued and taken for medical treatment, while 30 people are still unaccounted for. A multi-agency team including the military, police, county officials and humanitarian organisations is continuing search efforts, and authorities have set up a desk for families to report missing persons.
